title: Engaging with a Changing Planet Global Seminar
description: SYN 100GS is a project-based course that builds upon foundational skills by taking a collaborative, interdisciplinary approach to complex global problems. Each section focuses on a different theme, challenge, or question related to the climate crisis. Despite the different class topics, all students will learn by designing and executing a team project that addresses their section’s theme. This course is a global seminar. Prerequisites: upper-division standing, completion of SYN 1/1R and SYN 2/2R, must be taken for a letter grade to count toward Seventh College general-education requirements. Students must apply and be accepted to the Global Seminar Program to enroll. Duplicate credit with SYN 100.
